title: Release 4.3.5

title: CLI: Manually exit upon SIGINT reception
body: As per title. The CLI returns with a `130` (128 + SIGINT) exit code upon receiving a SIGINT (CTRL+C) signal.

title: Follow directory when deploying from create
body: As per title. Closes #4931

title: CLI: Add support for Secrets
body:
(Closes #4864). 
This PR adds subcommands to manage secrets in the `app` command: 
```
wasmer app secrets (create | update | list | reveal | delete)
```

title: Fix indirect call to dynamic imported function
body:
Fixes #4565.

The solution is to update the func_ptr of the anyfunc with the generated trampoline address during the resolve step. I'm not sure this is the best place for this code though; careful review is required.

title: Prevent unnecessary panics when compiling on x86_64 CPUs that dont support AVX or SSE4.2
body:
# Description
My company, Bitping, operates a distributed network of user devices to perform network tests and other types of work using WASM binaries. We use wasmer as the interpreter for these binaries and recently after an update one of our node operators with an AMD Turion II processor reported the following error at start up, which caused our application to fail to start.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb750a45-8556-4c77-a632-c55c61d73b64)

This PR attempts to solve the panic by returning a Result instead if compilation fails on older x86_64 CPUs that dont support AVX or SSE4.2.

I've successfully compiled the package locally as well as run the compiler_singlepass tests, which all pass.

title: Upgrade to Hyper 1.x
Fix stack_low detection when data_end is above stack_pointer and stac…
body:
…k_lower is missing

This PR removes a false warning, but the behavior should otherwise be identical to what it was before, although accidentally.

title: Release 4.3.4
body: [bot] Release wasmer version 4.3.4

title: fix(wasix): Fix incorrect webc version mapping
body: Closes #4921 .

title: Compile `wasmer-api` crate to `wasm32-unknown-unknown`
body:
This patch resolves compiler errors arising when compiling the `wasmer-api` (a.k.a. `backend-api`) crate to `wasm32-unknown-unknown` targets. 

The main complication was the explicit use of a type (`Pin<Box<dyn Stream<Item = Result<Vec<DeployApp>, anyhow::Error>> + Send + Sync>>`) that required a `Sync` that was not available in `wasm32`.

title: Fixed a race condition and access violation on multithreaded journals
body:
- Multithreaded journals were not clearing the replaying journal flag before the background threads resumed and thus caused some events to be lost
- The memory restore using decompressed journal extents was causing an access violation in certain scenarios where the memory already existed.

title: Release 4.3.3
body: [bot] Release wasmer version 4.3.3

title: Add tests for `msync`
body: This PR adds tests for the `msync` syscall added in this [PR](https://github.com/wasix-org/wasix-libc/pull/42) in the wasix-libc repo.

title: Fix mac runners
body:
since macos-11 is deprecated, the CIs were not able to find suitable
runners.

This fixes the issue by having CIs run using `macos-latest` instead.

title: feat(cli/push): Push with name if available (+ CLI flag)
body:
As of now, while users can push a package to a namespace without a version, they can't attach to it a name as well. This patch introduces the necessary infrastructure for the CLI to be able to push *unversioned* (as in, named, but without a version) packages to the registry. 

For example, if a manifest such as the following 
```
[package]
name = "my-namespace/my-package"
<no version> 
...
```
is found in the directory of the package to push, then the result of `wasmer package push` is to push to the registry a package bound to the identifier `my-namespace/my-package` but without a version. This can behaviour can also be enforced with the corresponding `--name` flag in the `push` subcommand. 

This does not allow users to *run* unversioned packages, as no consensus on naming was reached yet - this means that, as of now, executing  `wasmer run my-namespace/my-package:<hash>` will fail. Instead, users can run their package with `wasmer run <hash>`.

title: Update README: new zig bindings for wasmer with WASI Support
body:
Thanks to the whole wasmer community for a great wasm runtime!

# Description
## Motivation
The current Zig bindings for Wasmer are outdated and incompatible with recent Zig versions. They lack documentation, do not support WASI, and have minimal testing.

To address these issues, we introduce the wasmer-zig-api package. This new package ensures full backward compatibility while introducing several enhancements:
- Comprehensive documentation
- WASI support
- Extensive testing

You can easily add the wasmer-zig-api package via the official Zig package manager. For more details, visit:
- [Release v0.1.0](https://github.com/Afirium/wasmer-zig-api/releases/tag/v0.1.0)
- [Project documentation](https://wasmer-zig-api.crappy.systems/)

This package supports all Zig versions from 0.12.0 onwards.

My team and I have successfully deployed these bindings in production environments, and we are committed to maintaining compatibility with future releases of Zig and Wasmer.

title: feat(backend-api): Add query for retrieving app versions by id
body: Closes #4905

title: chore: More logging during package downloads
App create: Ask for framework before fetching templates
body: (attaching images as this is pretty much a design patch) In order to speed up the CLI reducing the size of the data requested to the backend and to provide a better UX, we wanted to introduce a new mechanism to present available templates to users. Before, we presented a list of all the available templates to the user: With this patch, the user first selects the framework they want and, after that, the actual template from the matching ones.

title: Re-use previously closed FDs
body:
This aligns with the Unix requirement that any newly returned FD must be the lowest unopened FD, and improves apps that use `select`, which only supports 1K FDs.

This PR also makes the FD table use ahash, which should be faster.

title: Added another journal transaction point used for durability
feat(cli): Amend `app` command description
body:
A bit of context:
> Improve description of wasmer apps from "manage apps" to "create and manage apps"

This patch changes the doc comment of the `App` subcommand from  `Manage deployed Edge apps` to `Create and manage Wasmer Edge apps`.

title: cli(app/create): Ask for directory to create the app in
body:
This PR introduces a mechanism that asks users the directory they want to save their app in in case the default app directory is not empty. 

A bit more context: 
> Currently "wasmer app create" assumes that you just want to use the current directory.
> This is not how most users will usually use this.
>
> They won't do: mkdir bla; cd bla; wasmer app create.
> Rather they will want to do wasmer app create , and have the result in bla.
> The command should prompt for a target directory (with it optionally being .).
> Should also have a flag to specify it in non-interactive mode.
> The default should probably remain . to not break things, also in non-interactive mode.

title: Replace mach with mach2
body:
Closes https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer/issues/4222.

See #4250

- **feat(backend-api): Add Distribution::webc_manifest field**

Closes #4802

title: feat(cli/deploy): Check status when waiting for the app to be available

title: feat(cli/deploy): Add `--path` flag
body: Tries to solve https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer/issues/4845

title: CLI: Use a channel to signal that the main fn is done
body: Tries to solve #4859. Use a channel to notify the `setup` thread that the main CLI function (`deploy`, `tag`, `push`..) is done and, in this case, should not wait for SIGINT to be received. Another approach could be that of simply calling `.abort()` on the `JoinHandle`.

title: chore: Small tracing log improvements for wasix
body:
Add some additional trace logs and information in journal restore and
thread spawning.

title: feat(cli/package-tag): Manifest is not mandatory anymore while tagging
body:
This PR tries to solve #4672 and #4788. 
This involves necessary breaking changes to the `tag` command which we introduced in 4.3.0, as before we had
```
wasmer package tag sha256:abc....    ./path/to/manifest_dir
```
and, in this PR, it should now be 
```
wasmer package tag sha256:abc.... namespace/name[version] 
```
So, keeping both args (path and namespace) to maintain backwards compatibility would make this PR nonsensical - as it would still need a manifest. Users can still specify a manifest to draw the info regarding the package to tag from with the `--package-path` flag. 

In general, this PR still keeps the concept of manifest in the tagging logic. This, of course, is to keep a minimum of backwards compatibility, but also because some package values - such as description, readme and so forth -  are better read off of the manifest, rather than passed via flag from the user.

title: Restored sockets from journals will no longer attempt to send data
fix(cli): Respect WASMER_REGISTRY env var in all commands
body:
The ApiOpts definition was missing the env declaration.

Closes #4843

title: Restore cursor after SIGINT during dialogue
body: As per title. This PR adds a `setup` function to `AsyncCliCommand` with a default implementation that installs a signal handler that restores the cursor (see https://github.com/console-rs/dialoguer/issues/77).  Solves #4837

title: fix(journal): Correctly handle client socket closing during compaction
body:
Previously outbound sockets were not properly recorded as open in the
compactor, and thus closed sockets were not properly removed from the
journal.

This change implements tracking for sockets after connecting to them.

Closes #4839

title: Don't pass auth header when downloading a package
body:
This small patch removes the auth header passed to Wasmer's cdn when downloading a package. Of course, this does not remove the mandatory auth when interacting with the graphql endpoint, which is still necessary. 

Furthermore, it makes the `--out-path` optional, and in case the user does not give a value for the flag it uses
`$(pwd)/namespace--name@version.webc` or `$(pwd)/hash.webc` as a filename.

title: Dynamically detect libgcc-vs-libunwind
body: An (in progress) fix for #4488

title: Fix for dead sockets restored in the journal
Fix `path_open` trailing slash edge case
body:
`path_open` discards trailing slashes when path_open is creating a new file.  This is a bug because trailing slash is semantically meaningful. Other runtimes like WasmEdge, Wazero, WAMR, Wasmtime, and Node correctly preserves the trailing slash.

fixes #4833

body: Minor fixes to some versions.

title: chore(virtual-fs)!: Remove old stale WebcFileSystem
body:
The old WebcFileSystem in virt-fs is not used anymore, and was just for webc v1
support, which has long since been removed.

This commit removes the implementation.

The associated tests should be re-written to WebcVolumeFs, but
preferably in a followup.

title: Merge `ScopedDirectoryFileSystem` into `host_fs::Filesystem`
body:
This PR merges the protection logic of `ScopedDirectoryFileSystem` into `host_fs::Filesystem`.

Resolves #4723.

title: Enable mounting `tmp` directory locally
body:
This PR adds tests in order to pin the behavior of the runtime regarding sharing the default created directories such as `/tmp`. Also, enables the user to mount the `tmp` directory locally.

Resolves #4764.

title: fix(cli): Respect owner in app.yaml during app resolution
body:
fix(cli): Fix app resolution - respect owner in config

The backend refactor that removed global aliases was not fully reflected
in the CLI, breaking "wasmer app get" and similar commands that all back
the reading the local app.yaml file.

This PR

* Removes the `Alias` variant of AppIdent, since there conceptually are no global
  aliases anymore, just domains

* Makes the resolution respect the `owner` in the config

* Falls back to trying to get the app by name with the current user as
  the owner

* Cleans up some related logic in the api crate

*Note*: we should add a way to retrieve apps by domain, but that requires additional backend support.

Closes #4818

title: Fix `path_open` sometimes ignoring trailing slash
body:
This commit fixes `path_open` sometimes ignoring the trailing slash.  On host Linux and other runtimes, opening an existing file with a path containing a trailing slash fails, but wasmer succeeds.

fixes #4820

title: Add support for spawning local wasm files
body: This PR adds support for spawning local wasm files.

title: chore(cli): Update yanked `zip` version
body: Resolves #4807

Adds a local template cache (currently 15 minutes), and fetches more templates
from the backend, currently up to 100.

Also sorts the templates by popularity now.

Improves the clarity of the result.

title: Disallow opening directory with rights::fd_write
body:
This commit changes `path_open` such that opening an existing directory with the `rights::fd_write` flag set returns an error `isdir`.  This behavior is consistent with other runtimes.

fixes #4766

title: Respect `oflags::excl` when opening all files
body:
This commit changes `path_open` to respect `oflags::excl` when opening all types of files.  Per POSIX, the behavior of `O_EXCL` is unspecified in the absence of `O_CREAT`, hence the addition of the `oflags::create` check.

fixes #4791

title: chore: Minor tweaks to the HttpRequest definitions
body:
For better serialization behaviour.

title: Fix metadata conversion to carry over the modified timestamp
body: This PR fixes the issue for returning zero modified timestamp when calling `metadata` or `read_dir`.

title: Multiple fixes for journaling with fast boot and resumption
body: These journal operations will now open an explicit file descriptor rather than renumbering one, this should prevent file descriptor overlap

title: Fix wasi-fyi test.sh on darwin
body:
The test script for wasi-fyi tests is broken on darwin which uses an older version of bash.  This fix uses a [workaround][1].

fixes #4775

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48394251/why-are-empty-arrays-treated-as-unset-in-bash

title: Reduce package upload chunk size to make the progress bar smoother
Use `_strict` graphql function so the error from backend is reported

this is necessary because otherwise, auth-related issues are misinterpreted as backend failures.

closes #4767

title: Update the webc dependency
body: Resolves #4750.

title: fix(wasix): Remove redundant module hash generation in BinaryPackage
body:
The hash is already available, no need to re-compute.

Closes #4785

title: Disallow empty path on path_open
body:
This commit changes `path_open` to return errno `noent` when the input path is empty.  This is consistent with other runtimes as well as Linux host. POSIX also specifies this behavior.

fixes #4755

title: Introduce `proc_exec2`
body:
This PR adds support for the `proc_exec2` syscall which is supposed to handle `execve`.

Resolves #4737.

body: Add bootstrapping configuration in the app.yaml config.

title: Only warn if needed
body: This patch will suppress the stack corruption warnings if asyncify is not used and hence its not a problem. This is to prevent all the large number of warnings that are being generated.

title: Fix for interrupts

Resolves #4721.

Hi,

I'd be happy if you could review this and merge it if the changes are satisfactory.

Thanks.

title: Argus: Compare v2 and v3 + add webhook message
body: This PR adds a new test in Argus, namely comparing webc v2 and webc v3 and a flag to specify a webhook to send a message once the test is finished.

title: Add traversal for `Root` inode
body:
This PR adds support for traversing the immutable `Kind::Root` whenever trying to create a directory. This operation should be permitted as long as the directory is not being created in the `Kind::Root`.

Resolves #4727
Resolves #4262

title: fix(cli): Actively wait for packages only after tag
body: Before we waited for native executables, bindings and so forth after pushing a package. This patch moves this wait after tagging it - that is, when a package version is actually available.

title: New CLI integration tests
body:
Add integration tests for the *deploy* command
  - Deploy a PHP app, check w/ random query param
  - Deploy a JS app, check w/ random query param
  - Deploy an Axum server, check w/ random query param
  - Deploy a static website, check w/ random contents

..and *create* command
  - Create a new app from an existing package (wasmer/hello)
  - Create a new app from a template (static-website)

title: Poll for write-readiness after connecting a blocking socket
Change the default directory the manual pages are generated to
body: Small PR: instead of generating by default to `./local/share/man`, generate to `./local/share/man/man1`.

title: Mount current directory to `/home` and Set CWD to `/home` when running WASI
body:
Resolves #4725
Resolves #4724
Resolves #4753

title: feat(cli): Fix erroneous subcommand as a `run` tentative
body:
This small PR introduces a mechanism that, in case the CLI parser fails to parse the command correctly, tries to dynamically match the first argument given to the CLI against the names of available subcommands before trying to interpret it as the name of a package to run. 

For example, this helps avoiding situations such as
```
$ wasmer deploy my-app
<tries to *run* the package `deploy`>
```

With this patch, it will instead result in: 
```
$ wasmer deploy test 
error: unexpected argument 'test' found

Usage: wasmer deploy [OPTIONS]

For more information, try '--help'.
```

I don't think that the overhead of this patch will be unbearable, but another, lighter possibility to avoid this problem is to make it so that the `wasmer_config::package::PackageSource` struct does not allow non-namespaced named packages, if viable (e.g. `namespace/name@version` is ok, `namespace/name` is ok, `name@version` is not)

title: Revert "make path_create_directory return error if no dir was created"
body:
This reverts commit 1f44a86acd3a30c17b6fae4f5d7f2a1e9209434f.

The commit must be reverted as it breaks sqlite running under WASIX.

title: Enable windows in CI again
body: This PR tries to re-enable windows for the `Unit-test packages on std` job, by setting the `RUSTUP_WINDOWS_PATH_ADD_BIN` env var.

title: Fix progress bar tick chars
body: The TUI lib seems to miss the last progress bar tick char. I added an extra `✶` so it wouldn't miss the final `✸`, and if the implementation is fixed at some point, the `✶` will simply be displayed for a bit longer than the other chars.

title: Refactor `wasmer_config::package::PackageHash` to be an enum
body:
<!-- 
Prior to submitting a PR, review the CONTRIBUTING.md document for recommendations on how to test:
https://github.com/wasmerio/wasmer/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests

-->

# Description
<!-- 
Provide details regarding the change including motivation,
links to related issues, and the context of the PR.

 Code cleanup:
 wasmer_config::package::PackageHash - Refactor to enum #4585

title: Disable windows in Unit-test packages job
body: This PR temporarily disables Windows for the `Unit-test packages` CI job since it has been failing with an unrelated error.

title: Remove owner and spurious informations from templates
body: If a template has an `app.yaml` that contains values for app name, owner, app_id and domain, remove them and substitute usable ones with user-provided values.

title: Add libc dep to workspace dependency
body: This PR adds `libc` as a workspace dependency and downgrades the version to `0.2.153` since `0.2.154` is yanked.

title: Remove `clock_time_get` instrumentation
body:
This PR reverts the instrumentation added to `clock_time_get` since it proved to add too much noise to the logs. Also, it adds an explanation as to why this syscall does not have an instrumentation.

Although it may help debugging some scenarios, especially in case of clock related bugs (see #4682), it makes debugging other scenarios more difficult since it clutters the logs.

title: Fix wasi-fyi tests
body: This PR aims to fix the issues in the virtual-fs layer in order to pass all wasi-fyi tests.

title: Multiple improvements for the journal load times
body:
- Compressed memory is now passed around rather than decompressed.
- Removed a copy operation on the journal save and restore
- Added improved journal compaction which removes more events
- Added new memory style properties that allow a backing file to be supplied

title: Use registry templates to create new app
body: As per title, this PR removes the old templating mechanism and institutes a new one using the registry templates, solving #4578. Mandatory screenshot: Side quests: - Passes the owner information from `wasmer deploy` to `wasmer app create` (solves #4701) - Correctly serializes the package information when creating from an existing manifest (solves #4674) - Implicitly solves #4605, but introduces a potentially breaking change: `new-package-name` is not used anymore and, as of now, the `static-website` template is not available from the registry (with that name, at least).

title: Rename when redirect is to the same fs
body: This PR is a second attempt at solving what #4667 tries to solve.

title: `wasmer app logs`: support app IDs, improve output format
body:
Using the `AppIdentOpts` instead of `Identifier`, the `logs`
subcommand can now fetch get a `DeployApp` instance from an ID, or a
name or an alias.

Misc: this commit also cleans up the formatting a little bit.

title: Fix calculation of stat.st_size in the presence of combined seeks and writes
feat(cli): Allow "wasmer app get" with an app version id
body:
Extends the `AppIdent` to support app version ids, so commands like "app
get/info/..." work with a specific app version.

This imrpvoes usability  and helps with debugging.

Closes #4694

title: feat(cli): Reimplement the webc upload progress bar
body: As per title. Resolves #4688

title: Pass down owner from deploy to publish
body: Resolves #4690

title: redirect to child node in a different fs
body:
This PR adds the missing logic in `mem_fs` for redirecting when resolving a child node that resides in a different fs.

Resolves #3575.

title: Fix offset in append mode
body:
This PR prevents a seek from changing the offset on a file when opened in append mode since the file offset must always point to the end of the file.

Resolves #4469 and #4681.
